questions.question_text:
An administrator wants to capture encrypted phase 2 traffic between two FortiGate devices using the built-in sniffer.
If the administrator knows that there is no NAT device located between both FortiGate devices, which command should the administrator run?

discussion.content: why D is wrong? without NAT it uses port 500

Selected Answer: B
A. wrong because FortiGate doesn't support AH.
B. correct because ESP is phase 2.
C. wrong because 4500 is for NAT'd traffic.
D. UDP port 500 is used for IKE. IKE is phase 1.

Selected Answer: B
esp = ip proto 50

Selected Answer: B
Answer: B

Selected Answer: B
The encrypted traffic goes with the ESP protocol.
Study Guide Page 443 -> ESP "ip protocol 50"

Selected Answer: B
IP proto 50 is valid
Example
FGT-SDWLAN-HQ # diagnose sniffer packet any 'ip proto 50'
interfaces=[any]
filters=[ip proto 50]
6.329185 172.168.203.1 -> 172.168.203.3: ESP(spi=0x0245b66f,seq=0x2cf)
6.329200 172.168.203.1 -> 172.168.203.3: ESP(spi=0x0245b66f,seq=0x2cf)
6.329210 172.168.203.1 -> 172.168.203.3: ESP(spi=0x0245b66f,seq=0x2cf)

diag sniffer packet any 'udp port 500' or diag sniffer packet any 'esp' would also be valid.
'IP proto 50' is not a valid filter

Variant of this question in my exam today : in the exhibit "send shortcut-query" instead "recv shortcut-query". In this case, we have a spoke and not a Hub. Replace auto-discover-sender by auto-discover-receiver

Selected Answer: D
D is correct — study guide 7.2 pg 333

The HUB receives the shortcut query and forwards it to the other spoke. 
The HUB then receives the shortcut reply from the other spoke and forwards the shortcut reply to the original spoke. 

Thus this is a HUB. 

A HUB is configured with set auto-discovery-sender enabled for ADVPN. 

auto-discovery-receiver is set on the Spokes, and not on the HUB. 
From the Spoke side, you would see either send shortcut query or send shortcut reply (which is not the case in this question).

i've taken the exam today and passed with full marks. Below is exactly correct.

Variant of this question in my exam today : in the exhibit "send shortcut-query" instead "recv shortcut-query". In this case, we have a spoke and not a Hub. Replace auto-discover-sender by auto-discover-receiver

Selected Answer: D
Spoke1 Hub Spoke2
 <-----Shortcut offer | 
 | 
 Shortcut query------> | 
 | Forward Shortcut query-----> 
 | 
 | <----- Shortcut reply 
 <-----Forward Shortcut reply |

comments.content:
Hub send Shortcut offer to spoke1
Spoke1 send Shortcut query to Hub
Hub send Forward Shortcut query to Spoke2
Spoke2 send Shortcut reply to Hub
Hub send Forward Shortcut reply to Spoke1

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Guy be careful with this one, I just took the exam and answered with auto-discovery-sender since I think it was from hub to spoke, in my reports it shows me that I did not get the all answers correct for the VPN part, and all the other answers I am sure that I was right the only one that I was not sure about it is this answer, 
The first thing I did after the exam was to come here to tell you and advise you to check all the answers and rely on the study guide, and check the exhibit carefully

Selected Answer: D
auto-discovery-sender -> HUB

Selected Answer: D
The logs are from a HUB (study guide page 475)
The correct answer is D-> auto-discovery-sender (study guide page 466)

Selected Answer: D
D is correct. It is a HUB.

A is correct 
Study guide page 467

Selected Answer: D
D. auto-discovery-sender

D is correct i think. Most crucial info to look for in these outputs is which dynamic IPsec's are used for sending/forwarding messages. Here we see that it did a route lookup on the H2S_0 tunnel, and that it had communicated with both sides on H2S_0_0 and H2S_0_1 so this would be a HUB definitely, so the IPsec setting on it must be auto-discovery-sender.

Selected Answer: D
Study Guide, page 463
Hub need to have auto-discovery-sender on SPOKE interface side
Hub can have auto-discovery-forwarder on HUB-HUB interface

Selected Answer: D
This is the HUB output, and we can see it receiving SHORTCUT-QUERY from a Spoke and forwarding to a different spoke. Hubs do this when they have " auto-discovery sender" configured on HubtoSpoke IPSec Interface

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
sender, cuz hub forwards query and replies

choices.B: If no action is taken, the primary FortiGate will leave the cluster due to the current sync status.
choices.A: If FGVM...649 is rebooted, FGVM...650 will become the primary and retain that role, even after FGVM...649 rejoins the cluster.
choices.D: If a configuration change is made to the primary FortiGate at this time, the secondary will initiate a synchronization reset.
choices.C: If port7 becomes disconnected on the secondary, both FortiGate devices will elect itself the primary.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A & C is okay
A and C

Selected Answer: AC
A - is correct - override disabled
B - not correct. FWs don`t leave HA because of out-of-sync
C - is correct, classic Split Brain
D - Not correct. The primary should initiate re sync.

Selected Answer: AC
A. If FGVM...649 is rebooted, FGVM...650 will become the primary that is normal since it will be the only active firewall and retain that role since override is disabled. Even after FGVM...649 rejoins the cluster, 650 will not fail over as slave.

C. If port7 (heartbeat port) becomes disconnected on the secondary, both FortiGate devices will elect itself the primary because when heartbeat communication fails, all cluster members think they are the primary unit (condition referred to as Split Brain) 

https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.4.0/best-practices/493254/heartbeat-interfaces

I’am going for C and D…

A is not possible because the active one is 649 and no rebooted is coming also override is disable so it doesn’t move back.
B primary will never leave the cluster because of a config sync, maybe the secondary need to be synced manually
Why A and C?
A and C.

Selected Answer: AC
A and C

choices.A: There is another other route to the same destination, with a lower distance.
choices.C: The next-hop IP address is unreachable.
choices.D: The interface specified in the route configuration is down.
choices.B: The route has a lower priority value than another route to the same destination.

Selected Answer: CD
A session is categorized as ephemeral when one of the following is true
 - TCP session is not fully established. 
 - UDP with only a single packet is received.

Selected Answer: CD
#Diagnose sys session stat
...
ephemeral=x/x - 1) not fully established TCP session (incomplete 3 way handshake-half open sessions), 2) UDP session with only one packet received.

Selected Answer: CD
CD gogo

questions.question_text: In which two states is a given session categorized as ephemeral? (Choose two.)

choices.A: A TCP session waiting for FIN ACK
choices.B: A UDP session with packets sent and received
choices.C: A UDP session with only one packet received
choices.D: A TCP session waiting for the SYN ACK
